answers.answer: I would get another just get another Endo, you have symptoms and this guy says go away and come back in six months! I would dump him just for not doing an anti-body test for aut-immune, Hashimoto's or Graves, some nodules will produce hormone on their own, and he only did a TSH. Just to save your self running back and forth trying to find the right MD, make a list of the Endos that you can go to, call the offices and ask them right out if this MD treats Thyroid, Does he base treatments on Free T3 and symptoms or on TSH aloneYou could be Hyper, with the palpatations, and acid reflux is common with thyroid issues,Then you can decide if you want to make an appointment with them or not based on the reply. You should have your Free T3 and Free T4 done, these are much more impotant than TSH since it is only a Pituitary Hormone. Good Luck and if you need any more info, Just Post. Regards FTB4

I had four nodules, three solid (up to 2.1 cm) and one 1.6 cm complex nodule all with vascularity, had possible calcifications, and my biopsy showed "benign follicular clusters", I still had cancer.  I also had normal thyroid function, that doesn't have much to do with cancer.  I don't know what the doctor is thinking, but at that size I would take out at least the 1/2 of the thyroid with that nodule and get it tested.  It won't go away, you will eventually have to remove it, and it is causing you discomfort.  I also have acid reflux, it gets better when I am medicated properly, but when I am low it gets worse.  I would get a second opinion, you are eventually going to have to have it removed, why wait?

thank you both for your information and input.  Sometimes I feel like I am crazy and imaging half this stuff especially when the Dr. kinda blows you off.  I will keep everyone posted through my process.

I can't believe the DR does not think the FNA results alone warrant more investigation.  Not to even mention the size.  I would find an Endo that specializes in Thyroid issues.  I had a 2cm nodule that was solid and hypoechoic and it turned out to be follicular variant of papillary cancer.  I also had another nodule that was classic papillary.  Don't let this go.

Thanks Katbid - I am having a bit of trouble finding an Endo - all that are in my insurance plan are "not accepting new patients" I am very fustrated and don't know where to turn.  I am trying to convince myself that any symptoms I feel are not related and I need to stop focusing on this lump in my throat, but its kinda hard when I feel it everytime I swallow and that my heart palpatations are all in my mind. lolI know I need to see another Dr. but who, which kind, I have really good insurance, don't need referrals and yet I can't get to a Dr. :(
What part of NJ are you in?

Call your insurance company & ask them what you are suppose to do since the "in network" endos are NOT taking new patients.....You may have to go out of network, but call your insurance benefits department...Careful on the endo you chose, because I know the ones in my area really only specialize in diabetes...& really could care less about the thyroid or its issues.

I live in Central Jersey (Middlesex).  If I can't get into an Endo - what other type of dr might be able to help.  I think this thing is getting bigger, I can actually see a lump now when I lift my chin up, I could never see it before but could feel it with my fingers and of course when I swallow.  I hate to seem paranoid and would love to forget about it but its impossible when there always feels like there is a litte ball in my throat when I try to swallow. :(
You could try a different ENT.
How about your gyno? I know mine will help out in the thyroid areas because she knows most endo's here only specialize in diabetes.

question: I will keep this brief.  Have a 3cm complex cystic mass right frontal lobe - US says vascular, multiple nicrocalcifications - FNA Biopsy results as I was told by the Dr. showed follicular cells and thats everything is fine.  I have only been tested for TSH and was told that was normal at 0.91.  Come back in 6 months for another ultrasound - (this is all from an ENT).........Now I have some trouble swallowing although not to bad kinda feels like I have to double swallow to get things down sometimes, I can clearly feel the lump everytime I swallow doesn't hurt but kinda annoying and weird feeling.  I get constant heart palpitations and heart burn which started around 3months ago and nodule was discoved about 1-1/2 months ago.  Now checking my neck more often I found a pea size lump guessing its a lymph node (even had my husband and son feel it to make sure I wasn't imagining it)   I feel tired and run down alot but I always chalk it up to working full time and raising 3 younger kids.  I ask the Dr. if the heart palpitations could have anything to do with the mass on my thyroid and was told no the nodules don't do things like that...not so sure I believe him but hey he is the Dr. right lolI am trying to decide if I should go for a second opinion and if so should it be another ENT or some other type of Dr. or should I just hang out with this 3cm mass in my neck and heart palpitations for 6 months and just see?Any advise would be greatly appreciated. :)
